summary: DOD has faced challenges acquiring new weapon systems—such as aircraft, ships, and satellites—on time and on budget. In 2018, DOD revised its process for reviewing and approving "capability documents," which identify new or enhanced capabilities in weapon systems. But DOD's information system for tracking these documents doesn't have reliable data about how many programs have gone through the revised process, or how long it takes...
title: Weapon System Requirements: Joint Staff Lacks Reliable Data on the Effectiveness of Its Revised Joint Approval Process
